intro: Leiphaimos domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican leiphaimos, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
